intro: Senecio calachaquensis, commonly known as the Calachaquén Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. This perennial species typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing a rosette of narrow, silvery-gray leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster, contributing to its ornamental appeal. The plant is adapted to high-altitude conditions, demonstrating resilience to cold and low-nutrient soils.
